alert.note: Alert for Jefferson (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Winter Weather Advisory issued January 09 at 9:38PM EST until January 10 at 7:00PM EST by NWS Buffalo
info.description: ...WINTER WEATHER ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 7 PM EST MONDAY... ...WIND CHILL WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 1 AM TO 1 PM EST TUESDAY... * WHAT...For the Wind Chill Warning, dangerously cold wind chills expected. Wind chills as low as 30 below zero. For the Winter Weather Advisory, snow. Additional snow accumulations of 2 to 4 inches through this evening on the Tug Hill. Lake effect snow may produce accumulations of 4-7 inches Monday across extreme southern Jefferson County. Winds gusting as high as 35 mph will produce blowing and drifting snow. * WHERE...Jefferson county. * WHEN...For the Wind Chill Warning, from 1 AM to 1 PM EST Tuesday. For the Winter Weather Advisory, until 7 PM EST Monday. * IMPACTS...Travel will be difficult at times with snow covered roads and reduced visibility. The dangerously cold wind chills could cause frostbite on exposed skin in as little as 10 minutes.
info.instruction: This is a potentially dangerous situation to be outdoors. If you must be outside, be sure to cover all exposed skin. Frostbite can occur in 15 minutes or less with apparent temperatures of 25 below zero or colder. Periods of snow will result in snow covered roads and limited visibilities. Slow down and use caution while driving. Submit snow reports through our website or social media.
